ThermochemicalData.name: G4-97 Test Set
ThermochemicalData.description: Gaussian-4 theory test set with 97 systems including enthalpies of formation, ionization potentials, electron affinities, and proton affinities
standard_refs: Curtiss et al. J. Chem. Phys. 126, 084108 (2007)

ThermochemicalData.name: Active Thermochemical Tables (ATcT)
ThermochemicalData.description: Comprehensive thermochemical network with 1500+ systems, self-consistent thermochemical values derived from thermochemical network optimization
standard_refs: Ruscic et al. J. Phys. Chem. A 108, 9979 (2004)

ThermochemicalData.name: Heat Capacity Test Set
ThermochemicalData.description: Temperature-dependent heat capacity for 50 molecules across 200-1000 K range

ThermochemicalData.name: BDE99 Bond Dissociation Energies
ThermochemicalData.description: 99 bond dissociation energies covering C-C, C-H, C-O, C-N, O-H, N-H bonds

ExcitedStateMethods.name: EOM-CCSD
ExcitedStateMethods.brief: Coupled-cluster excited state method for accurate vertical excitation energies
ExcitedStateMethods.description: EOM-CCSD treats ground and excited states on equal footing using similarity-transformed Hamiltonian. Provides accurate excitation energies with O(N^6) scaling. Excellent for valence excitations.

ExcitedStateMethods.name: CASPT2
ExcitedStateMethods.full_name: Complete Active Space Second-Order Perturbation Theory
ExcitedStateMethods.brief: Multi-reference perturbation theory for excited states with near-degeneracies
ExcitedStateMethods.description: CASPT2 combines CASSCF reference with second-order perturbation correction. Handles multi-reference character and near-degeneracies. Essential for photochemistry and transition metal complexes.
standard_refs: Andersson et al. J. Phys. Chem. 94, 5483 (1990)

ExcitedStateMethods.name: ADC(2)
ExcitedStateMethods.full_name: Algebraic Diagrammatic Construction to Second Order
ExcitedStateMethods.brief: Green's function based excited state method with O(N^5) scaling
ExcitedStateMethods.description: ADC(2) uses many-body Green's function approach through Hermitian eigenvalue problem. Provides excitation energies and spectroscopic properties with favorable scaling. Good balance of accuracy and cost.

ExcitedStateMethods.name: SAC-CI
ExcitedStateMethods.brief: Size-extensive CI method combining coupled-cluster and CI advantages
ExcitedStateMethods.description: SAC-CI uses cluster expansion operators with CI-like eigenvalue problem. Size-extensive by design, handles multiple excited states simultaneously. Particularly strong for singlet and triplet excited states.

ExcitedStateBenchmarks.name: QUEST Database
ExcitedStateBenchmarks.description: Highly-accurate vertical excitation energies for 500+ excitations using theoretical best estimates
standard_refs: Veril et al. WIREs Comput. Mol. Sci. 11, e1517 (2021)

ExcitedStateBenchmarks.name: Thiel Test Set
ExcitedStateBenchmarks.description: 28 small organic chromophores with valence and Rydberg excitations
standard_refs: Schreiber et al. J. Chem. Phys. 128, 134110 (2008)

ExcitedStateBenchmarks.name: Charge-Transfer Excitation Benchmark
ExcitedStateBenchmarks.description: 40 systems with challenging charge-transfer excited states
standard_refs: Loos et al. J. Chem. Theory Comput. 16, 1711 (2020)
